bboxes.raw_text:
Saint Marys High School will
present its Knights Band in
spring concert Friday at 8 pm.
in the Saint Marys Gymnasium,
230 East Polk, Phoenix.


The band composed of 46 MEM
bers directed by Loveless B. Liv-
ingston will present a varied
program of music.


Soloists will be Soloman Pa
dilla, trombone; Edith Beaver,
flute; and Larry Wilkinson,
trumpet.

Nearly $500 women will die
from breast cancer in 1864, more
than eight out Of ten will die
needlessly, because their cancer
will have been detected too late.


This Is one Of the many dis
couraging facts about cancer. Al
though one cancer patient in three
Is saved today, our medical
knowledge could save one in two.
The ability to save one half Of
cancer victims can only be real
lied when the public learns how
to discover cancer in It's early,
less noticeable stages.


The Maricopa County Unit Of
the American Cancer Society,
while conducting its annual April
Crusade will pass on llfe-saving
information which has been made
possible by the preceding cru
sades. Brochures describing
early symptoms of cancer will
be made available to all county
residents. The brochure will also
answer the most commonly asked
questions about the disease.

County Unit
OPENS Cancer
Drive Here

April Teaching Career Month aside salute the teachers Of
the nation

ST. MARY'S
